sentences.en: Airlift Loop Reactor ( ALR ) is used for gas - liquid or gas - liquid - solid reaction.
sentences.cn: 气升式反应器 ( AirliftLoop Reactor ) 是用于气 - 液或气 - 液 - 固相过程的接触性反应装置.

sentences.en: Airlift tipped the balance of the sieges.
sentences.cn: 空运扭转了这两场攻防战的战局.

sentences.en: An airlift was organized immediately for the relief of the flood victims.
sentences.cn: 立即组织空运救助遭受水灾的难民.

sentences.en: Flow pattern in the internal airlift loop reactors have two parts because of the tube.
sentences.cn: 由于内循环气升式反应器内存在导流筒,使得流场与鼓泡塔内的流场明显不同.

sentences.en: For months, these pilots delivered food by airlift and saved Berlin from starvation.
sentences.cn: 数月间, 这些飞行员们空运食物,拯救了饥饿的柏林.

sentences.en: Gas holdup and liquid circulation in an internal airlift loop reactor were investigated.
sentences.cn: 研究了气升式内循环反应器内的气含率与液体循环.

sentences.en: In the meantime the city has to airlift food products.
sentences.cn: 与此同时雅库茨克市又不得不空运食品.

sentences.en: President Garcia has ordered an airlift of food, medicines and blankets.
sentences.cn: 加西亚总统已经下令空运食品、药物和毛毯。

sentences.en: The airlift contact oxidation process is the combination of airlift technology with contact oxidation method.
sentences.cn: 将气提技术与接触氧化法相结合而形成气提式接触氧化工艺.

sentences.en: The airlift provided a lifeline for Berlin.
sentences.cn: 空运给柏林提供了一条生命线.

sentences.en: The German authorities are considering an airlift if the situation becomes critical.
sentences.cn: 如果局势变得危急，德国当局将考虑实施空运。

sentences.en: The injured were airlifted to a hospital in Dayton.
sentences.cn: 伤员被空运到代顿的一所医院。

sentences.en: The story of the Berlin airlift in 1948 - 49 has all that and more.
sentences.cn: 而1948年至1949年柏林空运的故事,不仅三者齐备,还有别的看点.

sentences.en: Then , too, the Soviet airlift was growing in magnitude.
sentences.cn: 还有, 苏联的空运规模日益增大.

sentences.en: We had the capacity to expand the scale of the airlift to match any Soviet escalation.
sentences.cn: 我们有能力扩大空运的规模,同苏联的任何升级行动相匹敌.

sentences.en: You can now airlift into cities of your vassal.
sentences.cn: 可以空运部队到附庸国城市.

trans.tran_cn: 空运，空运的旅客（或货物），空运补给线
trans.tran_en: an occasion when people or supplies are taken to a place by plane, especially during a war or dangerous situation
If people, troops, or goods are airlifted somewhere, they are carried by air, especially in a war or when land routes are closed
